etymology.description: 断(cut off/refuse) + 舍(discard) + 离(detach) = decluttering; minimalism.
etymology.interpretation: A minimalist practice (from Japanese 断捨離) that urges refusing unnecessary inflow (断), discarding excess (舍), and detaching from attachment (离) to live simply.
etymology.simplification: Traditional 斷捨離 became 断舍离 to reduce strokes: 斷→断 (component simplification), 捨→舍 (merged with phonetic 舍), 離→离 (component reduction).

parts.english: to sever; break; cut off; decide
to give up; abandon; discard; let go
to leave; separate; be apart from; detach

examples.chinese: 我开始练习断舍离(我開始練習斷捨離)，处理掉多年不用的衣物和书(處理掉多年不用的衣物和書)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ kāishǐ liànxí duànshělí, chǔlǐ diào duōnián bù yòng de yīwù hé shū.
examples.english: I started practicing duan-she-li, clearing out clothes and books unused for years.

examples.chinese: 断舍离不是清空一切(斷捨離不是清空一切)，而是与物欲保持距离(而是與物慾保持距離)。
examples.pinyin: Duànshělí bú shì qīngkōng yīqiè, ér shì yǔ wùyù bǎochí jùlí.
examples.english: Duan-she-li isn’t about emptying everything, but about keeping distance from material desire.

examples.chinese: 通过断舍离(通過斷捨離)，我的居家环境更简洁、心情更轻松(我的居家環境更簡潔、心情更輕鬆)。
examples.pinyin: Tōngguò duànshělí, wǒ de jūjiā huánjìng gèng jiǎnjié, xīnqíng gèng qīngsōng.
examples.english: Through duan-she-li, my home is tidier and my mood is lighter.
